TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TextureBrush extends System.Drawing.Brush

Docs.summary: Each property of the TextureBrush class is a object that uses an image to fill the interior of a shape. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to obtain a new bitmap using the <xref:System.Drawing.Image.FromFile%2A> method. It also demonstrates a TextureBrush.
This example is designed to be used with Windows Forms. Create a form containing a button named Button2. Paste the code into the form and associate the Button2_Click method with the button's `Click` event.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ImageExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.drawing.texture_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ImageExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.drawing.texture_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ImageExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.drawing.texture_1.vb)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object and an exact copy of that texture brush, and then uses the copy to fill a rectangle on the screen.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.drawing.texture_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.drawing.texture_0_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.drawing.texture_0_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Drawing.Image Image { get; }
.property instance class System.Drawing.Image Image

Docs.summary: Gets the object associated with this object.
Docs.value: An object that represents the image with which this object fills shapes.

MemberSignature.Value: public void MultiplyTransform (System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix matrix);
.method public hidebysig instance void MultiplyTransform(class System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix matrix) cil managed

Docs.param: The object by which to multiply the geometric transformation.
Docs.summary: Multiplies the object that represents the local geometric transformation of this object by the specified object by prepending the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The transformation matrix of a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object specifies how the image that defines the texture is transformed. For example, if the transformation matrix specifies a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise, the texture image is rotated by 90 degrees clockwise.
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Creates a new matrix that specifies a translation of 50 units in the x-direction.
- Multiplies the matrix with the transformation matrix of the texture brush.
- Fills a rectangle, using the texture brush.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.drawing.texture_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.drawing.texture_1_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.drawing.texture_1_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void MultiplyTransform (System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix matrix, System.Drawing.Drawing2D.MatrixOrder order);
.method public hidebysig instance void MultiplyTransform(class System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix matrix, valuetype System.Drawing.Drawing2D.MatrixOrder order) cil managed

Docs.param: The object by which to multiply the geometric transformation.
A enumeration that specifies the order in which to multiply the two matrices.
Docs.summary: Multiplies the object that represents the local geometric transformation of this object by the specified object in the specified order.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The transformation matrix of a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object specifies how the image that defines the texture is transformed. For example, if the transformation matrix specifies a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise, the texture image is rotated by 90 degrees clockwise.
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Creates a new matrix that specifies a translation of 50 units in the x-direction.
- Multiplies the matrix with the transformation matrix of the texture brush.
- Fills a rectangle, using the texture brush.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/c7dfa859-9377-4fef-8f43-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/c7dfa859-9377-4fef-8f43-_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/c7dfa859-9377-4fef-8f43-_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResetTransform ();
.method public hidebysig instance void ResetTransform() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resets the property of this object to identity.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Rotates the texture image by 90 degrees.
- Fills a rectangle.
- Resets the transformation matrix to identity.
- Fills a second rectangle.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.drawing.texture_5_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.drawing.texture_5_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#4](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.drawing.texture_5_1.cpp)]

.method public hidebysig instance void RotateTransform(float32 angle) cil managed

Docs.param: The angle of rotation.
Docs.summary: Rotates the local geometric transformation of this object by the specified amount. This method prepends the rotation to the transformation.

remarks.format:

- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Rotates the texture image by 90 degrees.

Docs.param: The amount by which to scale the transformation in the x direction.
The amount by which to scale the transformation in the y direction.
Docs.summary: Scales the local geometric transformation of this object by the specified amounts. This method prepends the scaling matrix to the transformation.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Scales the texture image by two times in the x-direction.
- Fills a rectangle on the screen, using the texture brush.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.drawing.texture_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.drawing.texture_2_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#7](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.drawing.texture_2_1.cpp)]

Docs.param: The amount by which to scale the transformation in the x direction.
The amount by which to scale the transformation in the y direction.
A enumeration that specifies whether to append or prepend the scaling matrix.
Docs.summary: Scales the local geometric transformation of this object by the specified amounts in the specified order.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Scales the texture image by two times in the x-direction.
- Fills a rectangle on the screen, using the texture brush.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/82733445-159b-4683-b7d2-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/82733445-159b-4683-b7d2-_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#8](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/82733445-159b-4683-b7d2-_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix Transform { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix Transform

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a copy of the object that defines a local geometric transformation for the image associated with this object.
Docs.value: A copy of the object that defines a geometric transformation that applies only to fills drawn by using this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A geometric transformation can be used to translate, scale, rotate, or skew the image that defines the texture of this brush. Because the matrix returned and by the Transform property is a copy of the brush's geometric transform, you should dispose of the matrix when you no longer need it.

MemberSignature.Value: public void TranslateTransform (float dx, float dy);
.method public hidebysig instance void TranslateTransform(float32 dx, float32 dy) cil managed

Docs.param: The dimension by which to translate the transformation in the x direction.
The dimension by which to translate the transformation in the y direction.
Docs.summary: Translates the local geometric transformation of this object by the specified dimensions. This method prepends the translation to the transformation.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Translates the texture image 50 units in the x-direction.
- Fills a rectangle on the screen, using the texture brush.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#9](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.drawing.texture_6_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#9](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.drawing.texture_6_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicTextureBrushExamples#9](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.drawing.texture_6_1.cpp)]

- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.TextureBrush> object.
- Translates the texture image 50 units in the x-direction.
- Fills a rectangle on the screen, using the texture brush.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Drawing.Drawing2D.WrapMode WrapMode { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Drawing.Drawing2D.WrapMode WrapMode

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a enumeration that indicates the wrap mode for this object.
Docs.value: A enumeration that specifies how fills drawn by using this object are tiled.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to obtain a new bitmap using the <xref:System.Drawing.Image.FromFile%2A> method. It also demonstrates the WrapMode property and the <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.WrapMode> enumeration.
This example is designed to be used with Windows Forms. Create a form containing a button named Button2. Paste the code into the form and associate the Button2_Click method with the button's `Click` event.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ImageExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.drawing.texture_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ImageExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.drawing.texture_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ImageExample#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.drawing.texture_1.vb)]
